y
The change from 150 pound chlorine cylinders to 1 ton chlorine cylinders has been a long and highly reviewed process. A primary objective of the conversion is to reduce the number of cylinder changes each day and year which should reduce the risk of a leak while changing out cylinders. The larger cylinders will also reduce the number of deliveries to the ADM Cheney mill. A complete design and replacement of the chlorine room is being implemented as a part of this process.

ay. To reduce the number of deliveries and to reduce the number of cylinder changes per day and year, ADM is switching to one ton chlorine tanks. In the future there may be up to 16,000 pounds of chlorine onsite. Typical chlorine onsite will be less than 8,000 lbs. 

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps
ADM Cheney utilizes the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rules as the base for its chemical safety for the handling and use of chlorine. ADM has relied upon internal and external knowledgeable personnel to plan for and build the new chlorine room, update and write new procedures, and train facility personnel. The new Halogen valves, considered to be the best available technology are being utilized to minimize potential leaks as cylinders are changed and to isolate cylinders in the event a leak is detected in the system. ADM Cheney personnel have worked with the Cheney Fire Department throughout the design and build process. 
Five Year Accident History
ADM Milling-Cheney has had two minor leaks in the past five years while using 150 pound chlorine cylinders but neither incident qualifies as an accident. The estimated release amounts were under three pounds of chlorine with no injuries and no offsite impacts.
Emergency Response Program
ADM Cheney has internal monitors and alarms for chlorine. They are connected to the Halogen main control valves and will shutdown chlorine service immediately when activated. These systems are periodically checked for functional capabilities. Preventative maintenance procedures are also followed. 
ADM Cheney completes periodic training with employees and contractors. At least once per year evacuation drills are completed. 
ADM Cheney communicates and plans with the City of Cheney Fire Department for emergency response. ADM will rely upon the Fire Department and the Spokane County EMA for communications with the public in the event of offsite evacuations.
Planned Changes to Improve Safet

ADM Milling  Cheney, WA
Risk Management Plan (RMP) Executive Summary
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
The ADM Milling-Cheney personnel utilize local and corporate procedures and guidance to manage chemicals safely These include standard operating procedures, work instructions, forms, and policies to ensure safe chemical handling and usage. Corporate safety and environmental resources are available to assist the Cheney facility with chemical safety. The following paragraph is ADMs Corporate EHS policy.
At ADM protecting people and the environment is part of everything we do and every decision we make.  We are committed to providing a safe work environment for all colleagues and contractors by continually pursuing ways to prevent workplace incidents and illnesses, protecting the environment, and enhancing environmental sustainability.  
To advance our EHS culture, we:
	Empower colleagues to make appropriate EHS decisions 
	Communicate concerns 
	Reduce risk and impacts through our conservation, prevention, and strategic planning efforts
	Continually improve through auditing, monitoring, and measuring our performance
	Provide the tools, resources, and training to meet and exceed our EHS responsibilities
These actions align EHS matters with our business strategies and sustainability objectives, and represent our strong commitment to our colleagues, customers, shareholders, and the communities in which we live and operate.
Facility Description and Regulated Substance
The ADM Milling-Cheney facility is a wheat flour mill that produces ingredients for the baking industry. The Cheney flour mill has operated for over 100 years with ADM Milling being the owner/operator for the past 36 years. The facility has utilized 150 pound chlorine cylinders for the chlorination of specific flour products for the 36 years that ADM has operated the mill.
